intro: Cordylanthus glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Cordylanthus glandulosus is a perennial herb that plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
